content.question: A player pays $15 to play a game in which a chip is randomly selected from a bag of chips. The bag contains 10 red chips, 4 blue chips, and 6 yellow chips. The player wins $5 if a red chip is selected, $10 if a blue chip is selected, and $20 if a yellow chip is selected. Let the random variable <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the amount won from the selection of the chip, and let the random variable <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the total amount won, where <math alttext="W equals X minus 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>X</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the mean of <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
